no recomiendo en este momento este juego ni con todo y nuevos personajes. con cosas muy buenas falla en aspectos clave como el balance y por decirlo de un modo, la monetización. 

versión detallada:
voy con los aspectos positivos primero que son varios y valiosos. para empezar, es un juego con una idea genial. el terror dentro de un multijugador asimétrico. y luego, el diseño de personajes es grandioso, en particular de los killers. son diseños en verdad muy buenos y esto incluye los que son y no son originales del juego (como Nemesis). por otro lado el ambiente y diseño de niveles a nivel estético funciona bien. el juego por momentos se siente en verdad de terror. es sombrío y violento por igual. en estos apartados se ha logrado muy bien todo. 

pero ahora voy con lo que en este caso, me pesa más, que es lo negativo. 

*el primer punto es que los personajes en su mayoría están bloqueados. y desbloquearlos ingame es muy lento. siendo un juego de pago esto es imperdonable. pues te impulsan a tener que gastar más dinero para tener más personajes. En muchos juegos gratuitos es más fácil conseguir personajes y skins nuevas. aquí se pasan de ambiciosos. 

*el juego está desbalanceado y cada vez esto empeora. esto es lo peor que pueden hacer con un multijugador. el desbalance viene favoreciendo a los survivors. y como son más, los desarrolladores les hacen caso a sus lloros y el desbalance es cada vez peor. 

*derivado de lo anterior, muchos jugadores ya se alejan o dejan de jugar como killers. por lo que encontrar partida como survivor es algo tardado y tedioso. 

*aunque esto no es del todo culpa de los devs. la comunidad de este juego es horriblemente tóxica. 

en fin. que con todo lo bueno que puede tener, al final es un juego frustrante y que te desanima a jugar, y todo va empeorando de a poco.  
6.5/10. No recomendado

so I reviewed this at 50 hours and gave it a thumbs down and then took away the review because I changed my mind. This game is/was fun. Now im 327 hours in and im posting this review again as a double thumbs down. There's pay to win elements, balance problems and mechanical issues with the game where you will press a button and receive NO OUTPUT; A mechanically broken game which is what has inspired me to repost this as a negative review. Do not pay full price only buy on sale. 500+ hour edit: uninstalled the game. You may enjoy this game if you buy it but my strong recommendation is DO NOT by any means buy it. Good luck have fun.

I've played this game for a few years on all platforms. I would say your best experience would be on PC and Playstation. I do have a great PC with a good graphics card, so using Nvidia filters with it make the game more scary than it already is, very strategic, every game feels different depending on all your perk build, love how they are still working on keeping the game alive and they are doing it well since 2016. I still love the game. What I say after this has been my experience for the past few months, the downsides to it is lately they have been lying to their staff and treating them bad. They need to get a new form of management in there who genuinely care about the community, rather than going in it for the money. Havnt spent anything really but 5 bucks for a DLC when I found out management has been involved with the NFT crap.
An absolute waste of my money furthermore, the lack of player count with the absence of good game mechanics make this the worst I have ever played

Dead by Daylight is one of the most unique experiences I have ever had in gaming. From the surface level it is a very simple competitive horror game, but the more you play the deeper and more complex the experience becomes.

To put it simply DBD is two different games with entirely different experiences mashed into one. You either play as a killer or one of four survivors put into a semi-randomly generated map where your goal is either to escape as a survivor or hook and kill everyone as the killer. In other words you are choosing between being the predator or the prey. This creates an interesting dynamic that I don't think any other game really comes close to. When playing one side you actually learn how to better play the other side. 

Survivor: When playing as the survivor you are part of a four man team versus a single killer. Your main objective is to work together with the other survivors to repair five generators that when finished will power exit gates that your team will then escape through. While repairing the generators you will be given skills checks in the form of quick time events that can speed up or slow down the process. Another aspect of playing survivor is avoiding / being chased by the killer. While being chased you are going to try to loop the killer through parts of the map that include pallets that you can throw down, windows you can jump through and a few other options. Your ultimate goal when being chased is to either escape and lose the killer or waste enough of his time that your fellow survivors can finish the generator repairs and then come save you later. I personally believe everyone should start out playing survivor in order to learn the tactics they use to avoid killer attacks. This will help you when starting out your killer gameplay.

Killer: When playing as the killer your main goal is to hunt down and kill all of the survivors before they can finish the generators and escape. Each killer is different with unique perks and kits available. Some are very simple with one ability and a regular attack while others are much more complex and have a few abilities at their disposal. When playing as killer you should be putting pressure on the generators and constantly looking for survivors to take out with your abilities and hook. After three hooks a survivor will permanently die and be removed from the game. The more people you take out the easier it will be to finish the game without the survivors escaping and anyone surviving. I recommend that you start with one of the simpler killers such as wraith, trapper or hillbilly to learn the game and then delve deeper into the list of harder more complex ones.

Overall Dead by Daylight is a unique and deep experience that I think anyone interested in online competitive co-op games or the horror genre in general should try out.

JOGO RUIM Q DEMORA PRA ATUALIZAR

1 lata de leite condensado
2 medidas da lata do condensado de leite
4 ovos
8 colheres de chocolate em pó
CALDA:
3 colheres de chocolate em pó
2 colheres de açúcar
2 colheres de água
Chocolate granulado para enfeitar
MODO DE PREPARO
Faça primeiro a calda na forma de pudim, misture o chocolate, o açúcar e a água e leve ao fogo até derreter.
Cuidado para não queimar, reserve.
Bata o restante dos ingredientes no liquidificador e despeje sobre a forma.
Cubra a forma com papel alumínio e coloque em banho-maria por 40 minutos.
Espere esfriar bem e desenforme jogue o granulado por cima.
Atenção, não desenforme quente nem morno para não despedaçar.
Leve à geladeira e sirva gelado.

Ahh, the 6.1.0 update. This update made DBD a lot less enjoyable. They could have nerfed everything except for the generator repair. The fact that it takes 90 seconds to repair generators made the game insufferably boring.

REALLY REALLY FUN! Rather than a sense of horror, this game uses a sense of terror. This game is super fun to play as a killer imo, ESPECIALLY with the demogorgon. If you have a spare $30, get this and the Stranger Things DLC before it goes offsale! The survivors are third person, and the killer is first person. I feel like it would be the other way around, but turns out being first person as the killer and third person as a survivor really fits  well. Overall, this game is awesome! Definitely buy it if you have money to burn.

"Man I love this game"

So yeah pretty good so far.

The learning curve for the game is steep in the beginning for survivors, but more forgiving for killers. The game tends to lean more into the direction of favoring the killer. But, the biggest flaw is Behavior's inability to balance the game. Rather than add new DLC, the company should look at fixing existing errors such as hit boxes still not making sense; deciding on what is, and what is not balanced (the nerf to DS, which I do not use); updating existing perks/powers; etc.

Behavior needs to re-evaluate where they were in the beginning to now, and bring all beginning content up to current speed. For example, when was The Shape truly evaluated, and compared to existing killers to see if he was balanced? Rather than throw more gimmicks at killers, I believe Plague was the beginning of the problem, why not adapt the existing killers to a more fair level. Some killer mains are already screaming about being weak, or having to use sweaty/tryhard builds to be competitive. 

(I am looking at you No One Escapes Skill. Sadly, this crutch perk teaches many killers to rely on their end game for kills, and discourages better game play. Why try, when I can slug at the end? I am fine with the speed buff, it is the unnecessary one-shot mechanic that I have issues with, especially when a Bubba (who is a one-shot wonder) is using this ability.) 

As a survivor, solo queue is the devil. The ranking system is a joke because you are not matched with people of your "skill" level. The pipping system is a poor way to match people, because you can easily pip up doing the bare minimum.  I do believe some of the perks need to be re-evaluated, but overall I enjoy playing survivor.

There are differing play styles between console, and PC gamers. Sadly, console players seem to be weaker in many aspects when compared to PC players, or make worse mistakes than PC players. Turning off cross play is almost not an option depending on the time you play, because you could be waiting in excess of 15 minutes for a match, which is the average time of a match. When it come to killers, there is also a VERY large distinction between console, and PC killers. Console players tend to tunnel/camp hooks much harder than PC killers. PC killers will actually progress the game, where console players hold games hostage if they start to lose. It is also obvious in the first minute of the game as to who you are going against as a survivor based on the ability of the killer.

Overall, I would not buy this game in the state that it is in currently, nor would I recommend it to a friend. Earlier patches, before Behavior's aggressive DLC schedule, were fun, and enjoyable. Now, it feels as if Behavior is like "who can we get as the new killer/survivor to make money?" (I know they want to release content that appeals to the player base, but please fix what you already have!) That said, Behavior does care about their players, or tries to get involved with them, but DBD is losing the fun it once had.
